column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Describe the Process of Bone
#Text=Healing to Kids
#Text=When a child breaks a bone , they are often scared and have many questions about how it is going to fix itself .
#Text=Explaining what is going on to the child can be quite difficult as the answers are often way beyond their comprehension .
#Text=It is important to use diagrams and terminology they can understand .
#Text=This article will provide strategies for explaining complex processes to children , along with a format to explain the bone healing process in a way a child can understand .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Meeting Them at Their Level
#Text=Ensure they know what a bone is .
#Text=Although the child may have heard the term bone several times they may not be entirely sure what it is .
#Text=Show the child pictures of a bone and explain where they can be found in the body and the role they play .
#Text=Use visuals .
#Text=It is important to show the child pictures and labelled diagrams of each step in the bone healing processes .
#Text=Providing visual aids will help to captivate the child 's interest by increasing their focus .
#Text=Having visuals will also aid in the child 's comprehension .
#Text=Keep it simple .
#Text=Try to use vocabulary they already know .
#Text=Avoid using scientific terms but rather describe it using physical attributes or the function .
#Text=Use similes .
#Text=There will be some new terms you cannot avoid using .
#Text=When this happens use smilies to help the child understand .
#Text=A smilie is the comparison of two different things in order to create a new meaning .
#Text=The comparison is usually made using the words " like " or " as .

#Text=Refer to phagocytic cells as  special cells " that come and eat the dead cells to get rid of them .

column1: #Text=By calling them special cells the child will get the idea that they are different from other cells .
#Text=Express the bone formation process by the physical features or the function of the biological term .
#Text=Instead of using the proper terminology , fibroblasts and osteoblasts , refer to them as bone forming cells .
#Text=Bone forming cells enter the area where the blood pool occurred and begin to remake the bone .
#Text=You can avoid using the term collagen fibers by explaining their physical properties .
#Text=The broken bone ends are connected with bundles of long thread like structures made out of protein .
#Text=You can refer to fibrocartilaginous callus as a repair tissue .
#Text=A temporary repair tissue is built between the broken bones .
#Text=Explain about spongy bone by focusing on its physical attributes .
#Text=The repair tissue is turned into spongy bone .
#Text=This spongy bone forms the inner layer of all bones and it looks a lot like a sponge .
#Text=It takes about 2 months for the broken bone ends to be joined together .
#Text=Show a picture of spongy bone to help the child understand .
#Text=Define remodeling to explain bone remodeling .
#Text=The spongy bone is then remodeled meaning the old bone is replaced by new bone .
#Text=Compare compact bone to a shell .
#Text=Lastly , a hard outer layer forms over the bone to provide protection and strength much like a shell .
